basics.name: Nabanita Dash
basics.label: Machine learning researcher
basics.summary: I am a senior year B.Tech. student at the Department of Computer Science and Engineering, International Institute of Information and Technology Bhubaneswar (IIIT Bhubaneswar), Bhubaneswar, India. I like working on open-source projects mostly those are hosted on GitHub. I have worked for iterative/DVC, SymPy, Haiku, JuliaLanguage, FluxModels, ReinforcementLearning.jl. Apart from working on open source, I like dabbling in game development, cooking, petting stray animals.

education.institution: International Institute of Information Technology, Bhubaneswar

work.summary: I organize the events at IIIT-BH which are funded and sponsored by GitHub.
highlights: We conduct competitive programming contests on Codechef monthly
We conduct a #45DaysofProductivity for IIIT-BH

work.summary: I interned as a Major League Hacking fellow'20 working on vision, reinforcement learning in Julia.
highlights: Developed a package for auto-adjustment of brightness using Julia Language and SciML within 3 days of hackathon
Developing vision(ResNet, GoogLeNet, vgg, InceptionNet v3,v4), RL(Dueling DQN, Quantile DQN, Actor-Critic) models in Julia in FluxModels.jl
Adding plot feature in AutoMLPipeline.jl package
Developed the base for gaming platform for MLH hackathon and won the community best award for it

work.summary: I organized the events at IIIT-BH which are sponsored by ACM-India.
highlights: We conducted a Hacktoberfest meetup where attendees were given a hands on experience about open source software and 3 students successfully merged their pull request to iterative/DVC who reimbursed us with 150 dollars
We conduct sessions and workshops helping attendees know and learn about technology and software development
We are collaboratively organizing events such as competitive programming, Hacktoberfest 2019, Linux fest, web development, android development, machine-learning
ACM-India, Bhubaneswar Chapter organized a hackathon at Devpost

work.summary: I organize the events at IIIT-BH which are funded and sponsored by GitHub.
highlights: We conducted a Hacktoberfest meetup where attendees were given a hands on experience about open source software and 3 students successfully merged their pull request to iterative/DVC who reimbursed us with 150 dollars
We conduct sessions and workshops helping attendees know and learn about technology and software development
We are collaboratively organizing events such as competitive programming, Hacktoberfest 2019, Linux fest, web development, android development, machine-learning
ACM-India, Bhubaneswar Chapter organized a hackathon at Devpost

work.summary: I developed recommendation engines for clients
highlights: Research and Development for metrics to be used for recommendation engines and ad campaigns for our clients
Working with Google analytics and Ad words data on campaigns to predict the customer’s visit to the client's website
Working on Budget optimization,forecasting of CTR, Impressions

work.summary: I helped students of age 13-18 to get started with JuliaLanguage
highlights: I am mentoring students and helping them with JuliaLanguage projects and specified tasks

work.summary: I developed a model predicting startup growth.
highlights: Created dataset concerning startups growth, IPO, Mergers and Acquisitions data by web scraping
I had to perform sentiment analysis on rumor data scraped from different financial websites
Developing a model that predicts startups growth and implementing it on AWS Sagemaker, EC2 instances and Google colaboratory

work.summary: I developed a LSTM model to evaluate stock-price.
highlights: Developed a model using single-directional LSTMs to predict the stock-price in ̝1 month̝ and achieved ̝72.6% accuracy
Collaboratively worked in a team to train, evaluate model

work.summary: I learnt VB and made changes in their website.
highlights: Learnt VB,.NET and improved NALCO's website by adding more linked pages and Updates section in ̝2 weeks̝
Collaboratively worked in a team on developing website for easy and accessible handling of information for all

volunteer.summary: Working for increasing diversity in Tech
highlights: Prepare weekly quiz questions
Wrote an article on 'How I got benefited from open source development' which got published in @Anita B.org
Conducted and lead a workshop on 'Introduction to Julia'
I helped at the #helpdesk and took notes from the sessions assigned to me
I asked questions on behalf of the other attendees
I have been organizing all the events for Campustry letting freshmen and sophomore year students know about how to write better resumes and all the opportunities provided by Campustry

volunteer.summary: Helped out at explaining tutorials and clarifying questions of fellow students
highlights: Clarifying fellow mates in clearing up their doubts in Python and Machine Learning with completing tasks of PyJaipur on Machine Learning and Deep Learning
